title: Why People Are Upset with the Prime Minister
summary: This article talks about a problem in the government. The prime minister, Sir Keir Starmer, hired a man named Peter Mandelson. Now, many people are angry because of things Mandelson did. Members of Parliament (MPs) are shocked and angry at Mandelson, but they are also angry with the prime minister for choosing him. People in the Labour Party are worried that Starmer might not stay as prime minister until 2027. They feel unhappy about how the government is handling things. Some think Starmer will have to leave his job sooner or later. The article shows that this anger is not just about one person; it is about bigger problems in the government that have been building for months.

background_read: In the UK, the prime minister is the head of the government and leads the country. The Labour Party is one of the main political parties. MPs are elected by people to represent them and make decisions. Sometimes, leaders make choices that cause problems, and people get upset. This article is about how a hiring decision led to anger and doubts about the prime minister's future.
Article_Structure: WHO: Sir Keir Starmer (prime minister), Peter Mandelson (a hired person), MPs and Labour Party members
WHAT: People are angry because the prime minister hired Peter Mandelson, and this has caused bigger problems in the government
WHERE: In the UK government and Labour Party
WHY: Because the hiring decision and Mandelson's actions have made people lose trust and think Starmer might not stay as prime minister

perspectives.description: They are upset with both Mandelson and Starmer for the hiring mistake and feel it shows bigger government problems.
